intro: Drymoanthus, commonly known as the mountain hibiscus, is a genus of flowering plants in the Malvaceae family. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas, particularly in mountainous areas. The plants typically have woody stems and produce showy, five-petaled flowers in shades of red, pink, and white. They are often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. Drymoanthus species are valued for their ornamental beauty and are sometimes cultivated in gardens.
